body_html:
To test:

  • follow instructions here to test your driver: http://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-installation-guide-mac-os-x/index.html#installation
    For example, I'm getting:
Katherins-Mac-Pro:release yukatherin$ ./deviceQuery
./deviceQuery Starting...

 CUDA Device Query (Runtime API) version (CUDART static linking)

cudaGetDeviceCount returned 35
-> CUDA driver version is insufficient for CUDA runtime version

which means I need to download the latest driver (http://www.nvidia.com/object/mac-driver-archive.html)
The problem is I do have the latest Mac Driver ... :(
https://devtalk.nvidia.com/default/topic/1025795/cuda-9-0-on-macos-10-13-high-sierra-/

body:
To test: 
- follow instructions here to test your driver: http://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-installation-guide-mac-os-x/index.html#installation 
For example, I'm getting:
```
Katherins-Mac-Pro:release yukatherin$ ./deviceQuery
./deviceQuery Starting...

 CUDA Device Query (Runtime API) version (CUDART static linking)

cudaGetDeviceCount returned 35
-> CUDA driver version is insufficient for CUDA runtime version
```
which means I need to download the latest driver (http://www.nvidia.com/object/mac-driver-archive.html)
The problem is I do have the latest Mac Driver ... :(
https://devtalk.nvidia.com/default/topic/1025795/cuda-9-0-on-macos-10-13-high-sierra-/
